page.title: 15Highland Dances Performed.
page.content: HIGHLAND FLING:Represents a sure footed deer.SWORDS:The victor in battle dancing over enemies swords.REEL OF TULLOCH:A church congregation warmed themselves by dancing to organ music.SHEAN TRUIBHS:After Jacobite times,men had to wear trousers.Disliking this the dancer demonstrates the shaking & kicking to remove them.FLORA McDONALDS FANCY:from the Hill Manuscript for women.SCOTCH MEASURE:Measure of Music. HEILAN' LADDIE:from the West Coast. BARRACK'S JOHNNIE;Danced by a Private as Ser.Major sought able men.SCOTTISH LILT:One of first used in Grade 1 ballet.VILLAGE MAID;As above-more recently.BLUE BONNETS:Revived recently EARL OF EARL:first danced in Peacock's Close,Aberdeen.Regretfully,little research has been done to date but hopefully might in the future.
